text: hello and welcome to bbc world news the
united states has criticized
afghanistan's new interim government
which includes figures accused of mass
killings a state department spokesman
expressed concern that it only includes
taliban members and so far no women or
figures from minority communities the eu
has also raised concerns and
afghanistan's self-styled national
resistance front says the taliban has
shown enmity with the afghan people
let's just take a look at some of the
key figures
is considered supreme leader of the
taliban he has led them since 2016. the
prime minister will be this man muhammad
hassan achant who is on a u.n terror
sanctions list he was deputy prime
minister in the previous taliban
government in the 1990s
surajin haqqani has been named as the
acting interior minister he is wanted by
the fbi and is head of the militant
group known as the haqqani network which
is affiliated with the taliban and have
been behind some of the deadliest
attacks in the country's two-decade-long
war including a truck bomb explosion in
kabul in 2017 that killed more than a
hundred and fifty people
malayakub is to be acting defence
minister he is the son of taliban
founder and late supreme leader mullah
omar
and taliban co-founder mullah abdul
ghani bharada will be one of the prime
minister's deputies
our chief international correspondent
lisa giusette is in kabul and she sent
us this assessment of the new taliban
regime
well not surprisingly western
governments have expressed concern
there's been a written statement from
the united states expressing concern as
you've just been reflecting about the
fact that it does it isn't inclusive in
the lease it doesn't include women it
doesn't include minorities there have
also
been comments on social media from
european diplomats uh also expressing
concern that this does not represent uh
the vast majority of afghans and i have
to say that on the streets today the
protests are continuing in fact they're
intensifying and the taliban reaction to
the protest has been also intensifying
there was a with with greater violence
more foreign journalists were arrested
today afghan journalists were arrested
today there was a women's protest in the
west of kabul they expressed their
criticism of the government announcement
last night the caretaker government but
meanwhile the taliban are getting on
with the business of government the new
ministers caretaker ministers have been
told to go to their offices to to meet
uh their people that will be working
with them
that was our chief international
